news.title: Gardaí travelled to England to interview family of missing child Daniel Aruebose
news.summary: A team of gardaí travelled to England as part of the investigation into the death of little Daniel Aruebose, whose suspected skeletal remains were found in a Dublin wasteland over four years after he was last known to be alive.

news.title: Coalition in move to raise minimum wage to above €14 an hour for 165,000 workers
news.summary: More than 165,000 workers are on course for a pay bump under coalition plans to increase the minimum wage by at least 55 cent an hour, pushing it above €14.

news.title: Family of missing woman Imelda Keenan say decision not to upgrade case to murder probe is ‘a huge blow’
news.summary: The family of missing woman Imelda Keenan have said they are devastated and angered by An Garda Síochána’s decision to not upgrade her case to a murder investigation.

news.title: Sports stars attract the crowds to garda tent on day three of National Ploughing Championships
news.summary: After two days of sunshine in Screggan, Co Offaly, the third and final day of the 2025 National Ploughing Championships was bound to be a damper affair.

news.title: Colm Keys: State’s €10m NFL pledge strengthens players’ case for deserved grant increase
news.summary: When Gaelic Players Association chief executive Tom Parsons was starting out on the road with Mayo in 2008, it was also the first year that inter-county players saw Government grants drop into their accounts.

news.title: Keep the €5 pints and be ‘good craic’ – Wild Atlantic Way pub is looking for a new manager
news.summary: Does a creamy pint after a morning surfing sound appealing? Have you recently been fighting the urge to relocate to a scenic location along the Wild Atlantic Way?

news.title: Condoms, flip-flops and phone chargers: A night with The Nee-Naw on Dublin’s Camden Street
news.summary: Camden Street in Dublin on a Saturday night hums with its usual energy, with taxis inching along the road, neon lights from bars and clubs flickering on to the paths, and people spilling out of venues, laughing and shouting.

news.title: ‘I squeezed a whole house into a side passage in Bray – the results inside might surprise you’
Modern Morals: I’m having intense romantic feelings for my therapist – should I tell him how I feel?
The Irish Independent’s View: Tragedy of Daniel Aruebose must bring about change
news.summary: When something terrible happens to a child, it can cause an emotional short-circuit in our society. There is shock and regret, and then a reboot to trusting our systems.
